intro: Acer shenzhenensis, commonly known as the Shenzhen maple, is a deciduous tree native to China. It is characterized by its distinctive palmate leaves that turn vibrant red in the autumn. The plant belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Its unique foliage makes it a popular choice for landscape design in urban environments.
